result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S Perales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater, Solicitation of, on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:48 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Matthew S Perales in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel agree that there is scrivners error on ROAW, date should be "4/9/16" not "15" in reference to credit
Atty Gonzalez informs the Court that he received a print out from the Sheriff this morning and it appears the in-custody dates do not match those listed by DOC
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Perales to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to any previously ordered sentence. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 160 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders conditions of Extended Supervision are to be those that were previously set as conditions of probation, including payment of all outstanding costs and fees.

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 2:08 pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

No record made: Case was scheduled for sentencing after revocation. Court, by agreement of Counsel reschedule hearing to Thursday, 6/30/16 to allow more time for arguments as prior hearing ran long for the Court. 

NEXT: NOTICES GIVEN IN COURT - Sentencing hearing on revocation REscheduled for June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 28, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Cases 14CF318, 14CF334, 14CF412, 14CM330 & 14CT316 called together at 11:30 am 
Defendant Matthew S Perales in court, in-custody, with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF412: Service of the Complaint admitted; reading waived

14CF318, 14CF334 & 14CF412: 
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Perales waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:-service of Information admitted, reading waived

ALL CASES: 
Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on 14CT316, Ct#1-14CF318, Ct#1-14CF334 & 14CF412; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts#2 & 3-14CF318 & 14CF334 and 14CM330

14CT316: Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25 + costs = $284.50 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $484.50; due in $25 incriments per month, beginning 1/31/15 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 3 demerit points assessed. No driver license revocation.  

On Ct#1-14CF318, Ct#1-14CF334 & 14CF412, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges (14CF412); to commence 12/19/14 by 7:00 pm 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment (within 90 days of release from jail) & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses at least 1x/mth for the 1st 6 mths of supervision
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No possession of drug parahernalia
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--100 hours community service (14CF318)
--To pay costs of $804 ($268 each count)
--To pay $750 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (Ct#1-14CF318)
--To reimburse $150 drug testing fee (14CF318)
--No contact with Jacki Rickerman unless injunction is dismissed & has Agent approval
APPLY CASH BOND FROM CASE 14CF318

Days credit for time already served: 7 days (9/12-9/19/14)-14CF318
Days credit for time already served: 76 days (9/19-12/3/14)-14CF334
Days credit for time already served: 0 days-14CF412

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court orders Mr. Perales to be booked in cases 14CF318 & 14CF412
Court informs Mr. Perales of 973.049 no contact provisions

Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

BOTH CASES: 
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Perales qualifies for SPD representation
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

14CM330: Defendant stands mute; Pleas of Not Guilty entered on Defendant's behalf; Speedy trial waived by Defendant

-No possession of drug paraphernalia without prescription, to include, but not limited to needles
